      (package private) java.util.function.UnaryOperator<javafx.scene.control.TextFormatter.Change> sizeLimits
      Prevents users from putting in none number characters and limits length of user input to 3 characters This is to be used for the widthTextField and heightTextField Users can only submit integers ranging from 0-999 meaning 999ft x 999ft is the upper limit of the garden

      • sizeLimits

        java.util.function.UnaryOperator<javafx.scene.control.TextFormatter.Change> sizeLimits
        Prevents users from putting in none number characters and limits length of user input to 3 characters This is to be used for the widthTextField and heightTextField Users can only submit integers ranging from 0-999 meaning 999ft x 999ft is the upper limit of the garden

      • changeSpendings

        public void changeSpendings​(int price,
                            long leps,
                            boolean addingPlant)
        Changes the current Spendings and lep count Boolean Value checks if the user is adding a plant or removing a plant
        Parameters:
        price - , cost of the plant
        leps - , amount of lep species supported
        addingPlant - , based on if this function is called when adding or removing a plant

      • removePlantHandler

        public javafx.event.EventHandler removePlantHandler​(Plant p)
        Handler for the removeplant function to be called in View.java
        Parameters:
        p - The plant being removed
        Returns:
        Removes the plant from the garden, readds the cost, and removes the added leps

      • removePlant

        public void removePlant​(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event,
                        Plant p)
        Removes a plant from the garden when right clicked Also updates the balance, lep count, and current plants list
        Parameters:
        p - The plant object that determines what is to be removed and what info it has such as cost and lep count
        event - the mouse event that causes this to start, this function will only work for right clicks

      • resetGarden

        public void resetGarden​(javafx.scene.layout.Pane pane)

        After user decides to go back to the input screen, it resets all values and plants.

        Parameters:
        pane -

      • setAllPlants
